availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Maryland,
Baltimore City, To wit:

I, Dalrymple Williams, resident in the said City of Baltimore, duly commissioned by the Executive authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds for the said Commonwealth, to fulfill the duties of said office within the State of Maryland, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties pertinent to such station.
Subscribed and sworn before me, a Justice of the peace of the State of Maryland in and for the City of Baltimore, this Thirtieth day of May. 1862.
State of Maryland, Baltimore City, Sct:

I HEREBY CERTIFY, That Allen E Forrester Esquire, before whom the annexed affidavit was made, and who has thereto subscribed his name, was at the time of so doing a Justice of the Peace of the State of Maryland, in and for the City of Baltimore, duly commissioned and sworn.
IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I hereto set my hand and affix the seal of the Superior Court of Baltimore City, this 30th day of May A. D. 1862

Geo E Langston
Clerk of the Superior Court of Baltimore City.

Maryland
Official Oath of Dalrymple Williams
Commissioner for Kentucky in Maryland
